content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 20 to node 9 is:

20 -> 21 -> 4 -> 9

The shortest path uses the edges in the graph from node 20 to node 21 (with weight 13), from node 21 to node 4 (with weight 2), and from node 4 to node 9 (with weight 2). The path does not pass through any other nodes or edges, so it is the shortest possible path from node 20 to node 9.

The shortest path from node 20 to node 4 is:

20 -> 21 -> 4

The shortest path uses the edges in the graph from node 20 to node 21 (with weight 13), and from node 21 to node 4 (with weight 2). The path does not pass through any other nodes or edges, so it is the shortest possible path from node 20 to node 4.
